evidence.snippet: From the start of March 2008, <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.8)">rumors</mark> that <mark>Obama</mark> was <mark>born</mark> in <mark>Kenya</mark> before being flown to Hawaii were <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.21123758376000001)">spread</mark> on conservative websites, with the suggestion that this would disqualify <mark>Obama</mark> from the presidency.[30] In April of that year, some <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.1888048478)">supporters</mark> of Hillary Clinton <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.20341187280000003)">circulated</mark> anonymous chain emails repeating the same rumor;[31] among them was an Iowa campaign volunteer, who was fired when the story emerged.[32][33] These and numerous other chain e-mails during the subsequent presidential election <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.20341187280000003)">circulated</mark> <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.4075716504)">false</mark> <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.8)">rumors</mark> about <mark>Obama's</mark> <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.17808128688000002)">origin,</mark> religion, and birth certificate.[34][35] On June 9, 2008, Jim Geraghty of the conservative website National <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.2988454292)">Review</mark> Online suggested that <mark>Obama</mark> release his birth certificate.[36][37] Geraghty wrote that releasing his birth certificate could <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.059977412640000005)">debunk</mark> several <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.4075716504)">false</mark> <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.8)">rumors</mark> <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.20341187280000003)">circulating</mark> on the Internet, namely: that his middle name was originally Muhammad <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.1154758048)">rather</mark> than Hussein; that his mother had originally named him "Barry" <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.1154758048)">rather</mark> than "Barack"; and that Barack <mark>Obama</mark> Sr. was <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.20829318584)">not</mark> his biological father, as well as the <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.8)">rumor</mark> that Barack <mark>Obama</mark> was <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.20829318584)">not</mark> a natural-born citizen.[37][38][39] In August 2008, Philip J. Berg, a former member of the <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.0237391809)">Democratic</mark> State Committee of Pennsylvania, <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.0934469831)">brought</mark> an unsuccessful lawsuit <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.54561051896)">against</mark> <mark>Obama,</mark> which <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.54032383488)">alleged</mark> "that <mark>Obama</mark> was <mark>born</mark> in Mombasa, Kenya."[40][41]

<mark>Obama</mark> s official life narrative states that his father, Barack Hussein <mark>Obama,</mark> left <mark>Kenya</mark> for the U.S. in 1959 to study at the University of Hawaii at Manoa, where he <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.06628755432)">reportedly</mark> met Kansan Stanley Ann Dunham. <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.2834043784)">According</mark> to the narrative, Barack Hussein <mark>Obama</mark> II was <mark>born</mark> on August 4, 1961 in Honolulu, <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.1256813696)">although</mark> <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.38541531)">no</mark> hospital in the state of Hawaii has <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.373749712)">claimed</mark> to be his birthplace. Further uncertainty exists as to whether or <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.20829318584)">not</mark> Barack <mark>Obama</mark> from <mark>Kenya</mark> ever married Dunham, and the Hawaii Department of Health (HDOH) does <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.20829318584)">not</mark> release vital records to anyone without a direct and tangible interest in the record. <mark>Obama</mark> described his stay at Mama Sarah s home without running water as a way for him to <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.070060552)">connect</mark> with his past, different though it was from the life to which he had been accustomed in the U.S.

<mark>Kenya:</mark> Authorities Release Barack <mark>Obama</mark> s Real Birth Certificate Nairobi | The Office of the Principal Register of the Nyanza Province, in <mark>Kenya,</mark> has finally released 11 exclusive documents concerning Barack <mark>Obama</mark> s <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.54032383488)">alleged</mark> birth and early childhood in the country. These official papers had been requested for years by the Tea Party Patriots, an American conservative organization, to <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.38541531)">no</mark> avail, but the Kenyan Supreme Court recently ordered authorities to release the documents, based on a law on access to <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.3116533852)">information.</mark> These files, if they turn out to be verifiable, could mean that Mr. <mark>Obama</mark> had <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.38541531)">no</mark> legal right to become the American president under the country s law. The papers released today suggest that Barack <mark>Obama</mark> was <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.25727071152000003)">actually</mark> <mark>born</mark> on March 7, 1960, in Lamu, <mark>Kenya,</mark> more than a year before his father moved to Hawaii, where he <mark style="background-color: rgba(255,0,0,0.022761489600000004)">allegedly</mark> met his mother.

<mark>Obama</mark> was forced to leave his Ph.D. program at Harvard University in May 1964 (and received an M.A. in economics from Harvard in 1965).[44][29][38][50][51] In June 1964, <mark>Obama</mark> met and began dating a 27-year-old Jewish American elementary school teacher named Ruth Beatrice Baker, the daughter of prosperous Lithuanian immigrants to the United States.[52][53][54] Return to <mark>Kenya</mark> Third marriage <mark>Obama</mark> returned to <mark>Kenya</mark> in 1964 after graduating from Harvard.[55] Baker <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.3183254997)">followed</mark> him, and they married 24 December 1964.[56] They had two sons together, Mark Okoth <mark>Obama</mark> in 1965 and David Opiyo <mark>Obama</mark> in 1968.[57] Baker and <mark>Obama</mark> separated in 1971,[58][59] and divorced in 1973.[44][29] Baker subsequently married a Tanzanian man named Ndesandjo and <mark style="background-color: rgba(0,255,0,0.0399060888)">took</mark> his surname, as did her sons Mark and David. Mark said in 2009 that <mark>Obama</mark> had been abusive to him, his late brother David, and their mother.[22][53][54] Economics career <mark>Obama</mark> first worked as an economist for an oil company in <mark>Kenya.</mark>

It featured Mr <mark>Obama</mark> s correct date of birth and includes the masthead: Coast Province General Hospital, Mombasa, British Protectorate of <mark>Kenya</mark> .
